channel.title: Trivia on Gabor Parti
channel.description: Recent content in Trivia on Gabor Parti

item.title: Nutmeg in the flag of Grenada
item.description: I have been drawing flags ever since I was a kid, and all my life I thought that the Grenadian flag has tiny little flame. Now, after spending 3 years on a PhD thesis about spices, I found out that the flag features an open nutmeg fruit (Myristica fragrans), for its important role in the island’s economy. Isn’t that neat.

item.title: The .io domain name
item.description:
What is the .io domain name and why is it problematic? Link to heading

Preferred by tech companies, the .io domain name does not actually refer to the input-output word pair (I/O) we all learned about in primary school. I still remember that IT teacher - Gyuri bácsi - with the black mustache and white lab-coat trying to calm us down when the first Windows 98 PCs arrived. We suddenly got slapped in the face by the ever-accelerating pace of technology and subsequently forgot all our (very limited) MS-DOS skills. The last Linux machines were left behind in the old számtechterem1, jinxing the future towards a world more inhumane, ruled by for-profit tech companies.
